result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher Lee Habermann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Pay all applicable court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA surcharge by 03-09-2020 or to be docketed as a civil judgment/tax intercept.
Provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.

Straight time. Credit for 52 days.

Court will allow HUBER for work search and treatment once the defendant has served the condition time in Racine County Case 2015CF001434.


Consecutive to: any other sentence

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher Lee Habermann

records.addlTxt: JOC Corrected to include the $35.00 warrant fee

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

The Court ordered defendant to serve 7 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 52 days time served, STRAIGHT TIME. 

The court will allow HUBER for work search and treatment once the defendant has served the condition time in Racine County Case No. 2015CF001434.

Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.

Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs, fees and surcharges (including DNA surcharge) by 3/9/2020, or to be docketed as a civil judgment/tax intercept.

Filed;
-Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Christopher Lee Habermann in court with attorney Angel Johnson.  Student Intern Michelle Alexander under the supervision of Assistant District Attorney Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.
Defendant's Bail Forfeiture Notice returned undeliverable.
No reply from defendant or surety.  sb

Attorney Angel Johnson in court, defendant Christopher Lee Habermann not in court, in custody.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for plea and sentencing. Defense counsel requests more time. Court ordered case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 47.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 9, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Angel Johnson in court, defendant Christopher Lee Habermann not in court, in custody.  May Y. Lee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM
Branch 31 for Branch 47.  Case in court for bail/bond hearing.  Court ordered case bail be lowered to $200.00.  All other bail conditions remains the same.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 14, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with all Pick n Save stores in Milwaukee County.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.

Defendant Christopher Lee Habermann in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Defendant Christopher Lee Habermann in custody.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for January 30, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($200.00) gj
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 200.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Angel Johnson in court.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Angel Johnson in court.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until 1/17/2017.  Calendar call scheduled for January 17, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christopher Lee Habermann in court with attorney Angel Johnson.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for plea and sentencing, defense requests final pre-trial and jury trial dates.  Case remains calendared in Branch 47.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 21, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for January 23, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christopher Lee Habermann in court with attorney Angel Johnson.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for plea and sentencing. Defense counsel requests more time. Court ordered case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 47.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 20, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Christopher Lee Habermann in court with attorney Zoe Everett for Angel Johnson.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel requests more time. Court ordered case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 47.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Christopher Lee Habermann in court with attorney Angel Lee Johnson.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM  
Case in court for Plea and sentencing.  Defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 47.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 28, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christopher Lee Habermann in court with attorney Angel Lee Johnson.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defense motion to adjourn is granted. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 5, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Christopher Lee Habermann in court with attorney Angel Lee Johnson.  Jaclyn Schwartz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense motion to adjourn is granted.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 18, 2016 at 08:30 am.

16RM003688  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
01/28/2016

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with all Pick N Save stores in Milwaukee County.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Christopher Lee Habermann in court.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  OCCR Tape#16-014
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 47 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
$200 cash bail posted at Greenfield Police Department
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 1-22-2016 at 1:30pm

Attorney Angel Lee Johnson in court, defendant Christopher Lee Habermann not in court, in custody.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.
